glsa.title: CSTeX: Multiple vulnerabilities
glsa.synopsis: Multiple vulnerabilities were discovered in CSTeX, possibly allowing to execute arbitrary code or overwrite arbitrary files.

background.p: CSTeX is a TeX distribution with Czech and Slovak support. It is used for creating and manipulating LaTeX documents.

description.p: Multiple issues were found in the teTeX 2 codebase that CSTeX builds upon (GLSA 200709-17, GLSA 200711-26). CSTeX also includes vulnerable code from the GD library (GLSA 200708-05), from Xpdf (GLSA 200709-12, GLSA 200711-22) and from T1Lib (GLSA 200710-12).

impact.p: Remote attackers could possibly execute arbitrary code and local attackers could possibly overwrite arbitrary files with the privileges of the user running CSTeX via multiple vectors.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.

resolution.p: CSTeX is not maintained upstream, so the package was masked in Portage. We recommend that users unmerge CSTeX:
As an alternative, users should upgrade their systems to use teTeX or TeX Live with its Babel packages.
